parameters.name: entry_d
parameters.description: The descriptor of the ACL entry whose type you want to set.

parameters.name: tag_type
parameters.description:
The type that you want to assign to the entry; one of the following:

  
ACL_GROUP â a named group.
    
  
ACL_GROUP_OBJ â the owning group.
    
  
ACL_MASK â the maximum permissions allowed for named users,
    named groups, and the owning group.
    
  
ACL_OTHER â users whose process attributes don't match any other
    ACL entry; the “world”.
    
  
ACL_USER â named users.
    
  
ACL_USER_OBJ â the owning user.

full_content:
Function: acl_set_tag_type
URL: https://www.qnx.com/developers/docs/7.1/com.qnx.doc.neutrino.lib_ref/topic/a/acl_set_tag_type.html
Synopsis: int acl_set_tag_type( acl_entry_t entry_d,
Headers: #include <sys/acl.h>
Parameters:
  - entry_d: The descriptor of the ACL entry whose type you want to set.
  - tag_type: The type that you want to assign to the entry; one of the following:

  
ACL_GROUP â a named group.
    
  
ACL_GROUP_OBJ â the owning group.
    
  
ACL_MASK â the maximum permissions allowed for named users,
    named groups, and the owning group.
    
  
ACL_OTHER â users whose process attributes don't match any other
    ACL entry; the “world”.
    
  
ACL_USER â named users.
    
  
ACL_USER_OBJ â the owning user.
Examples:
Example 1:
#include <sys/acl.h>

int acl_set_tag_type( acl_entry_t entry_d,
                      acl_tag_t tag_type );
